creator: bjoern@hoehrmann.de

text:
The length of the list is always:
   CSSEngine.getNumberOfProperties()

   on the CSSEngine the created the StyleMap.
This might be nice to have but really isn't that
important given that the class is intended to be
interal to the CSSEngine.  Introducing this might
lead developers to think each StyleMap could have
a differing number of properties.
creator: deweese@apache.org
bjoern@hoehrmann.de
text:
I see. How about changing the StyleMap.toString() method to use 
getNumberOfProperties() instead of values.length then?

creator: deweese@apache.org
text:
As I said I don't really mind adding it (after the release)
but it can't use getNumberOfProperties because a StyleMap
IIRC doesn't hold a reference to it's CSSEngine (and adding
one for this purpose would be silly ;).

Ah, I should have said the existing toString(CSSEngine) method which does have 
such a reference... It could also be a /*comment*/ that getNumberOfProperties 
can be used to get the lenght of the list, it's just meant as an improvement 
for people trying to make sense of the code...
creator: bjoern@hoehrmann.de

text: I added a comment to StyleMap.toString(CSSEngine) as suggested.
